Actions.ActionName: Track this macro's usage
If it's the first run of this version, show the first run screen
Very early setup—clear vars, activate, test, etc.
Check if KM is running, and if so, is it visible
Actions.Text:
--Disabled loop to avoid -600 errors as it was very slow!
--set apscDone1 to false--set loopCount1 to 0--repeat until apscDone1 is true or loopCount1 is 15--	try--if application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" is not running then tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" to launchtell application "System Events"	try		set isKMvisible to visible of process "Keyboard Maestro"	on error		set isKMvisible to "KM not active"	end tryend tellset kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE"tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"	setvariable "instance_KMappStatus" instance kmInst to isKMvisible	-- will be either true (visible) false (hidden) or "KM not active" (not running)end tell--		set apscDone1 to true--	on error--		set apscDone1 to false--		set loopCount1 to loopCount1 + 1--	end try--end repeat

Actions.ActionName: Wait to be sure KM is frontmost
Save current window size and location to variables
If this isn't first run, show a little placeholder window…
Display a placeholder window so we know the macro is running
Actions.Text:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
	<head>
		<meta charset="utf-8" />
		<title>MacroBackerUpper</title>
		<style type="text/css">
			body {
				font-family: -apple-system;
				font-size: 14px;
				opacity: 1;
				transition: opacity 2s ease-in-out;
			}
		</style>
	</head>
	<body data-kmwindowid="theSplash" style="background: #e6ffac">
		<script>
			function KMWindow() {
				//fromleft, fromtop, width, height
				return "460,300";
			}

			// Close the window with fade-out after 2 seconds
			setTimeout(function () {
				document.body.style.opacity = 0;
				setTimeout(function () {
					window.close();
				}, 300); // Wait for the transition to complete before closing
			}, 300);
		</script>
	</body>
</html>

ThenActions.Text:
The menu item File → Export → Export All Macros as Folder isn't available.

This macro can't run unless it's available. I wish I knew why it wasn't available right now, but it's not—it should be available any time the Keyboard Maestro editor is frontmost. The macro will now exit. Please check the status of the menu, and once it's available, please try the macro again.

Clear leftover variables

Actions.ActionName: Get the newest folder
Tell the user what happened if the backup failed

Actions.Title: Error: The backup failed to run
Actions.Prompt:
This really shouldn't happen, and hopefully you'll never see this dialog. But if you do, please contact me on the Keyboard Maestro  forums—there's a link in the Info: Read Me First! macro.

The macro will now delete the database, as it's in an unusable state for future backups, then exit. You can try running MacroBackerUpper again if you wish—at worst, you'll see this dialog again. At best, it works.

Actions.ActionName: Delete the database as it's in a bad state after a failed backup

Actions.Parameter: Backup failed, inform user and quit

Actions.ActionName: Do some variable-setting administrivia
Save a copy of the UUID files, in case we have to rebuild the database
Get count of folders in backup folder

Actions.Parameter: +Set some variables and copy UUID files to backup folder

Actions.ActionName: Count macros and groups
Extract counts from the database
The SQL commands
Actions.Text:
SELECT (
SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM groups_new)
|| '←🔸→' ||
(SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM macros_new)
AS counts

Actions.ActionName: SQL: Extract the matching records
Parameters: Count all groups and macros in the database

Actions.ActionName: Split out the two totals from the results

Actions.Parameter: Count the records in the database

Actions.ActionName: Analyze each macro group folder for changes
The main processing loop for first and subsequent backups
Get the second newest folder
Make sure the temp files are gone before starting

Actions.Parameter: Get ready for more-than-one backup work

Parameters: Analysis: Moved and renamed macros and groups

ElseActions.ActionName: Analyze new, deleted, identical, and modified activity

Parameters: Analysis: New, deleted, and identical macros and groups

ElseActions.ActionName: Analyze modified groups, macro by macro
Create "__latest" alias at top of folder list

Actions.ActionName: Remove existing alias
Create the new alias via AppleScript
Actions.Text: set apscDone1 to falseset loopCount1 to 0repeat until apscDone1 is true or loopCount1 is 15	try				--if application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" is not running then tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" to launch				try			set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE"			tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"				set theLocation to getvariable "rg_MBU_BackupLoc"				set theFolderToAlias to getvariable "instance_TheLatestFolderName" instance kmInst			end tell						set myPath to theLocation & "/" & theFolderToAlias						tell application "Finder"				make new alias at POSIX file theLocation to POSIX file myPath				set name of result to "__latest"			end tell		end try						set apscDone1 to true	on error		set apscDone1 to false		set loopCount1 to loopCount1 + 1	end tryend repeat
